item.title: Lobsters Top Stories: Tuesday, October 15, 2024 at 7:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. The Stallman Report (115 points | 99 comments)
2. Boring Tech Is Stifling Improvement (26 points | 40 comments)
3. New passkey specifications will let users import and export them (8 points | 7 comments)
4. Moving to LLVM IR (17 points | 4 comments)
5. a protocol for reliable notifications over a 1 bit fallible connection (11 points | 1 comment)
6. Why make software? (11 points | 2 comments)
7. OpenD on iPhone/Mac/etc.: ldc gets extern(Objective-C), dmd gets pragma(linkerDirective) and @section (15 points | 1 comment)
8. Large language models reduce public knowledge sharing on online Q&A platforms (31 points | 13 comments)
9. Graphics Tricks from Boomers (7 points | no comments)
10. vortex: A toolkit for working with compressed Arrow in-memory, on-disk, and over-the-wire. "The LLVM of file formats" (16 points | no comments)
11. Antithesis: Pioneering Deterministic Hypervisors with FreeBSD and Bhyve (9 points | 1 comment)
12. Minetest Rebranding to Luanti (24 points | 6 comments)
13. What are you doing this week? (21 points | 32 comments)
14. The `Overwrite` trait and `Pin` (10 points | 1 comment)
15. Ward Christensen, BBS inventor and architect of our online age, dies at age 78 (9 points | 1 comment)
16. Use an External GPU on Raspberry Pi 5 for 4K Gaming (6 points | no comments)
17. Trust Rules Everything Around Me (WordPress, Code Security, etc.) (21 points | no comments)
18. Run Linux Containers on FreeBSD 14 with Podman (6 points | 1 comment)
19. Text-overflow: Ellipsis Considered Harmful (2022) (10 points | 2 comments)
20. Ubuntu Will Include The Latest Linux Kernel Version in Future Releases (22 points | 33 comments)
21. Deriving the Kelly Criterion to maximise Profits (9 points | no comments)
22. Arduino to switch from Arm Mbed to Zephyr RTOS (3 points | 1 comment)
23. FFmpeg Explorer (2023) (15 points | 1 comment)
24. The Tragedy of the Common Lisp: Why Large Languages Explode (2015) (15 points | 4 comments)
25. fjall: LSM-based embeddable key-value storage engine written in safe Rust (8 points | 1 comment)
